nodes.documentation:
@title Hashed Timelock Contracts (HTLCs) on Ethereum ETH.
 * This contract provides a way to create and keep HTLCs for ETH.
 * See HashedTimelockERC20.sol for a contract that provides the same functions 
for ERC20 tokens.
 * Protocol:
 *  1) newContract(receiver, hashlock, timelock) - a sender calls this to create
     a new HTLC and gets back a 32 byte contract id
 2) withdraw(contractId, preimage) - once the receiver knows the preimage of
     the hashlock hash they can claim the ETH with this function
 3) refund() - after timelock has expired and if the receiver did not 
     withdraw funds the sender / creater of the HTLC can get their ETH 
     back with this function.
nodes.name: HashedTimelock

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "timelock time must be in the future"

arguments.value: timelock time must be in the future

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "timelock time must be in the future"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "withdrawable: timelock time must be in the future"

arguments.value: withdrawable: timelock time must be in the future

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "withdrawable: timelock time must be in the future"

nodes.name: newContract
withdraw
refund
getContract

nodes.documentation:
@dev Is there a contract with id _contractId.
@param _contractId Id into contracts mapping.
nodes.name: haveContract

nodes.documentation:
@dev Is there a contract with id _contractId.
@param _contractId Id into contracts mapping.
nodes.name: haveContract

getContract(bytes32).return: All parameters in struct LockContract for _contractId HTLC

newContract(address,bytes32,uint256).details: Sender sets up a new hash time lock contract depositing the ETH and  providing the reciever lock terms.

params._timelock: UNIX epoch seconds time that the lock expires at.                  Refunds can be made after this time.

newContract(address,bytes32,uint256).return: contractId Id of the new HTLC. This is needed for subsequent                    calls.

refund(bytes32).details: Called by the sender if there was no withdraw AND the time lock has expired. This will refund the contract amount.

params._contractId: Id of HTLC to refund from.

withdraw(bytes32,bytes32).details: Called by the receiver once they know the preimage of the hashlock. This will transfer the locked funds to their address.

params._preimage: sha256(_preimage) should equal the contract hashlock.

devdoc.title: Hashed Timelock Contracts (HTLCs) on Ethereum ETH. * This contract provides a way to create and keep HTLCs for ETH. * See HashedTimelockERC20.sol for a contract that provides the same functions  for ERC20 tokens. * Protocol: *  1) newContract(receiver, hashlock, timelock) - a sender calls this to create     a new HTLC and gets back a 32 byte contract id 2) withdraw(contractId, preimage) - once the receiver knows the preimage of     the hashlock hash they can claim the ETH with this function 3) refund() - after timelock has expired and if the receiver did not      withdraw funds the sender / creater of the HTLC can get their ETH      back with this function.
